reasoning: Photoparoxysmal response (PPR) is an abnormal EEG response to intermittent photic stimulation. Estimated in 3-10% of people with epilepsy (~0.5-0.8 per 100k). Genetically heterogeneous condition. Can occur as isolated EEG finding or with overt photosensitive seizures.
source: Epilepsy and EEG literature; NIH Genetic Testing Registry
